page.title: 20CHANGING LANDSCAPE
page.content: {East Ogwell}is on the outskirts of Newton Abbot. Nearby are low rolling hills and the small fields are mostly permanent pasture, where cattle graze. In just a few places small patches of woodland break up the{farming {landscape.}From here you can see the village of{Denbury}beneath its hillfort, and{Haytor}on the western edge of{Dartmoor.}Narrow winding lanes have tall hedges on both sides which makes driving hazardous. Bungalows built in the 1960's,with large gardens are on the outskirts of East Ogwell. A large new{development}near the main Newton Abbot to Totnes road has two storey houses of various styles with small gardens.Opposite is an old stone quarry used today as a depot by a firm of forklift truck makers.Several large farms houses with outbuildings and barns are spread throughout the area.
